message_1:
Suppose you have a dataset of scores from a test taken by 20 students. The test had four sections: Reading, Writing, Math, and Science. The scores are listed below:

```
Reading: 89 92 75 68 90 83 79 85 88 81 87 94 86 77 82 72 80 78 91 84
Writing: 70 73 68 82 75 80 73 78 77 69 83 72 79 70 81 85 88 84 76 74
Math: 80 85 90 72 78 82 88 85 77 81 74 87 92 94 89 78 83 86 90 76
Science: 84 87 91 96 79 83 75 88 85 82 78 80 83 90 89 87 81 72 76 70
```

Calculate the mean, median, and mode for each section of the test.
message_2:
To calculate the mean, median, and mode for each section, we first need to sort the scores in ascending order.

Reading: 68 72 75 77 78 79 80 81 82 83 84 85 86 87 88 89 90 91 92 94
Writing: 68 69 70 70 72 73 73 74 75 76 77 78 79 80 81 82 83 84 85 88
Math: 72 74 76 77 78 78 80 81 82 83 85 85 86 87 88 89 90 90 92 94
Science: 70 72 75 76 78 79 80 81 82 83 83 84 85 87 87 88 89 90 91 96

Now, we can calculate the mean, median, and mode for each section.

Reading:
Mean: (68+72+75+77+78+79+80+81+82+83+84+85+86+87+88+89+90+91+92+94)/20 = 82.5
Median: (81+84)/2 = 82.5
Mode: No mode, as all scores appear only once.

Writing:
Mean: (68+69+70+70+72+73+73+74+75+76+77+78+79+80+81+82+83+84+85+88)/20 = 76.5
Median: (77+78)/2 = 77.5
Mode: 70 and 73 (both appear twice)

Math:
Mean: (72+74+76+77+78+78+80+81+82+83+85+85+86+87+88+89+90+90+92+94)/20 = 82.5
Median: (82+83)/2 = 82.5
Mode: 78 and 85 (both appear twice)

Science:
Mean: (70+72+75+76+78+79+80+81+82+83+83+84+85+87+87+88+89+90+91+96)/20 = 82.5
Median: (82+83)/2 = 82.5
Mode: 83 and 87 (both appear twice)

So, the mean, median, and mode for each section are:

Reading: Mean = 82.5, Median = 82.5, Mode = None
Writing: Mean = 76.5, Median = 77.5, Mode = 70, 73
Math: Mean = 82.5, Median = 82.5, Mode = 78, 85
Science: Mean = 82.5, Median = 82.5, Mode = 83, 87
